intro: Selliguea caudiformis, commonly known as the forked moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its delicate, leafy structure and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a thalloid body with a distinct, often branched appearance, and its leaves are typically arranged in a spiral pattern. Selliguea caudiformis is often found growing on rocks or soil in temperate regions, and it plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
